intro: Chenopodium urbicum var. chrysomelanospermum, commonly known as the golden Chenopodium, is a variant of the common lambsquarters. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its upright growth habit and alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its seeds are often coated in a yellowish pigment, giving it its common name. It is typically found in disturbed soils and urban environments, such as roadsides and vacant lots. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
